transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Thank you for calling Nexus Customer Support. This call may be recorded for quality and training purposes. My name is Maria, how can I help you today?
Customer: Hi Maria, I have a question about my latest bill. I was charged $89.99 but my plan is supposed to be $79.99.
Agent: I'd be happy to look into that billing concern for you. For security purposes, can I please verify your account? Could you provide me with your full name and the last four digits of your account number?
Customer: Sure, it's Rebecca Torres, account ending in 4781.
Agent: Thank you, Rebecca. And can you confirm the email address on file?
Customer: Yes, it's rebecca.torres@email.com.
Agent: Perfect, I've verified your account. Now let me pull up your latest invoice. I can see the charge you're referring to. It looks like there was a $10 add-on for international calling that was activated on February 12th.
Customer: Oh, I didn't realize that got added. My husband might have called about that.
Agent: That makes sense. I can see there was a request made on February 12th to add the international calling package. Would you like me to keep it on the account, or would you prefer to remove it?
Customer: Can you remove it, please? We don't need it anymore.
Agent: Absolutely. I've gone ahead and removed the international calling add-on effective today. You'll also see a prorated credit of $5.16 on your next statement for the unused portion.
Customer: Oh great, that's really helpful. Thank you.
Agent: You're welcome. I understand how confusing unexpected charges can be, so I'm glad we could get this sorted out quickly for you. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
Customer: No, that was it. You've been very helpful.
Agent: Thank you for calling, Rebecca. Have a wonderful day!
Customer: You too, bye!
transcripts.customer_issue: Unexpected $10 charge on monthly bill due to international calling add-on

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Nexus Support, this is James. What can I do for you?
Customer: Hi, I'm trying to make a payment on my account but the website keeps giving me an error.
Agent: Okay, let me pull up your account. What's your name?
Customer: Michael Dawson.
Agent: Got it. What's your account number?
Customer: It's 7829-4401.
Agent: Alright, I see your account here. So the website isn't letting you pay?
Customer: Right. I keep entering my card info and it says transaction failed. I just want to pay my bill.
Agent: Let me try processing the payment on my end. Can you give me your credit card number?
Customer: Sure, it's 4532 8891 2244 6677.
Agent: Okay, so your card number is 4532 8891 2244 6677. And the expiration date?
Customer: 09/28.
Agent: And the three-digit security code on the back?
Customer: 442.
Agent: Alright, let me run that through. One moment... Okay, the payment of $134.50 has been processed successfully. You should see it reflected on your account within 24 hours.
Customer: Great, thanks. Why wasn't the website working though?
Agent: It could be a browser issue or a temporary glitch on our end. Try clearing your cache next time or use a different browser.
Customer: Alright, I'll try that.
Agent: Anything else?
Customer: No, that's all.
Agent: Okay, have a good one.
Customer: Thanks, bye.
transcripts.customer_issue: Unable to process payment through website, agent processed payment manually over the phone

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Nexus Support, James speaking.
Customer: Hi, I need help with my bill. I was overcharged by $247 and I'm really upset about this.
Agent: Okay, what's your account number?
Customer: It's 5501-3378. But listen, I've been a loyal customer for six years and this is unacceptable. I noticed the charge three days ago and it's been eating at me.
Agent: Let me look at the account. Okay, I see the charge. It looks like you were billed for a premium tier upgrade.
Customer: I never asked for a premium upgrade! I didn't authorize that. This is really frustrating, I'm on a tight budget and $247 is a lot of money for me right now.
Agent: The system shows it was activated on February 18th. I can submit a dispute form for you.
Customer: A dispute form? How long does that take? I need this money back now. You don't understand, this overdrew my bank account.
Agent: The dispute process takes 7 to 10 business days. I'll fill out the form now.
Customer: Seven to ten days? That's the worst service I've ever experienced. I didn't even authorize this charge and you're telling me I have to wait over a week?
Agent: That's the standard process. I can also remove the premium tier so you won't be charged again next month.
Customer: I want it removed immediately, and I want to know how this happened in the first place. Can someone explain how a charge I never authorized ended up on my account?
Agent: It may have been a system error. I've removed the premium tier and submitted the dispute. You'll get an email confirmation.
Customer: This has been a terrible experience. I'm seriously considering taking my business elsewhere.
Agent: The dispute has been submitted. Is there anything else?
Customer: No. I'm very disappointed.
Agent: Okay, goodbye.
transcripts.customer_issue: Unauthorized $247 premium tier charge on account causing financial hardship

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Thank you for calling Nexus Customer Support. This call may be recorded for quality and training purposes. My name is Maria, how can I assist you today?
Customer: I want to cancel my subscription. I'm done.
Agent: I'm sorry to hear that. Before we proceed, may I ask what's prompting you to consider leaving us? I want to make sure I understand your concerns.
Customer: Your prices keep going up every year. I've been looking at your competitor TeleVox and they're offering the same plan for $20 less per month. I'm switching to them next week.
Agent: I completely understand your frustration with the price increases, and I appreciate you being transparent about that. You've been a valued customer with us for over four years, and I can see you've been on the same plan for a while. Let me see what options we have for you.
Customer: I've already made up my mind. I just want to cancel my account.
Agent: I respect that, and I can absolutely process the cancellation if that's what you'd like. But would you give me just two minutes to check something? I want to make sure you're aware of all the options available to you before you go. There's no pressure at all.
Customer: Fine, two minutes.
Agent: Thank you. So I can see you're currently on our Standard Plus plan at $89.99 per month. I actually have access to a loyalty rate that I can apply to your account right now. It would bring your monthly cost down to $64.99, which is actually $25 less than what you mentioned TeleVox is offering.
Customer: $64.99? That's a big difference. What's the catch?
Agent: No catch at all. It's a loyalty rate we offer to long-term customers like yourself. It locks in that price for 24 months, so you won't see any increases during that period. You also keep all your current features, including the premium support line.
Customer: That does sound better. But I was also frustrated because last month my service went out for two days and nobody told me what was going on.
Agent: I'm really sorry about that experience. I can see the outage on your account history, and you're right, that should have been communicated proactively. What I'd like to do is apply a one-time service credit of $30 to your account as an apology for that disruption. And I'm going to flag your account for priority outage notifications going forward.
Customer: You know what, that actually sounds fair. Let me think about it for a second.
Agent: Take your time. There's absolutely no rush.
Customer: Okay, let's go with the loyalty rate. Don't cancel the account.
Agent: Wonderful! I'm so glad we could work something out. I've applied the $64.99 loyalty rate starting on your next billing cycle, and the $30 credit will appear within 48 hours. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Customer: No, that's great. Thanks Maria, you've been really helpful.
Agent: It's my pleasure. Thank you for staying with us, and please don't hesitate to call back if you ever have any concerns. Have a great day!
Customer: You too, bye!
transcripts.customer_issue: Customer wanted to cancel subscription due to price increases and competitor offers

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Nexus Support, David speaking. How can I help?
Customer: Hi David, I need to update my mailing address on my account.
Agent: Sure thing. What's the new address?
Customer: It's 1542 Maple Drive, Apartment 3B, Portland, Oregon, 97205.
Agent: Okay, I've updated that for you. Anything else?
Customer: Actually, yes. Can you also update my email address? I have a new one.
Agent: Sure, what's the new email?
Customer: It's jthompson.new@gmail.com.
Agent: Done, email updated. What else?
Customer: Wait, don't you need to verify who I am first? You just changed my address and email without confirming my identity.
Agent: Oh, right. Um, can I get your name?
Customer: It's Jennifer Thompson. But honestly, you already made the changes. What if I wasn't actually Jennifer?
Agent: I apologize about that. Let me confirm, what's the date of birth on the account?
Customer: March 15, 1988. But the changes are already made. This doesn't seem very secure.
Agent: You're right, I should have verified you first. I apologize for that oversight. Your identity is now confirmed though. Is there anything else you need?
Customer: Actually, can you check what phone number is on file? I want to make sure it's current.
Agent: The phone number on file is 503-555-0147.
Customer: Good, that's correct. One more thing, can you tell me when my contract renewal date is?
Agent: Your contract renews on April 1st, 2026. You're currently on a month-to-month plan.
Customer: Okay, good to know. That's everything.
Agent: Alright, have a good day.
Customer: Thanks, bye.
transcripts.customer_issue: Customer needed to update mailing address and email address on account

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Thank you for calling Nexus Support. This call may be recorded for quality and training purposes. My name is Lisa, how can I help you?
Customer: Yeah, this is the third time calling about the same issue. My internet has been dropping every evening for the past two weeks and nobody has fixed it.
Agent: I'm sorry to hear about the connectivity issue. Can I get your account number?
Customer: It's 6642-9910. I already told the last agent everything. They said a technician would call me back within 24 hours and nobody ever called.
Agent: Let me pull up your account and look at the notes.
Customer: I've been waiting for two weeks for this to get resolved. Every evening between 7 and 10 PM my internet just dies. I work from home and I've already contacted my manager about the problem because I can't join evening meetings.
Agent: I see your account here. It looks like you're on our 200 Mbps plan.
Customer: I know what plan I'm on. I already told the previous agents. Can you actually fix the problem this time? I keep repeating myself every time I call.
Agent: Let me run a diagnostic on your line. One moment please.
Customer: Sure, been waiting for that for two weeks now.
Agent: The diagnostic shows some signal fluctuations in the evening hours. This could be due to network congestion in your area.
Customer: So what are you going to do about it?
Agent: I can schedule a technician to come check your equipment and the line to your home. The earliest available slot is March 3rd.
Customer: March 3rd? That's five more days! I've already been dealing with this for two weeks. This is completely unacceptable.
Agent: Unfortunately, that's the soonest we have a technician available in your area.
Customer: This is incredibly frustrating. I've called before about this exact problem, I've already contacted you multiple times, and every time I'm told to just wait. I'm seriously considering switching providers.
Agent: I understand. Would you like me to book the March 3rd appointment?
Customer: I guess I have no choice. Yes, book it.
Agent: Okay, you're scheduled for March 3rd between 9 AM and 12 PM. A technician will come to your home.
Customer: Fine. This better actually happen this time.
Agent: Is there anything else I can help with?
Customer: No. Just make sure someone actually shows up.
Agent: The appointment is confirmed. Have a good day.
Customer: Bye.
transcripts.customer_issue: Recurring internet outages every evening for two weeks, third call about the same issue

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Hello! Welcome to Nexus Support chat. This chat is being recorded for quality purposes. My name is Lisa. How can I help you today?
Customer: Hi Lisa, I'm locked out of my online account. I've tried resetting my password three times but I never get the reset email.
Agent: I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble accessing your account. Let me help you get that sorted. For verification purposes, could you please provide your full name and account number?
Customer: Alex Rivera, account 8834-2201.
Agent: Thank you, Alex. Can you also confirm the email address on file?
Customer: It's alex.rivera@protonmail.com.
Agent: Perfect, your identity has been verified. Let me check your account settings. I can see the issue. It looks like there's a typo in the email address stored in our system. It shows "alex.rivra@protonmail.com" without the second "e" in Rivera.
Customer: Oh that explains it! The reset emails were going to the wrong address.
Agent: Exactly! I've corrected the email address to alex.rivera@protonmail.com. Would you like me to trigger a new password reset email now?
Customer: Yes please!
Agent: Done! You should receive the reset link within the next 2 minutes. Please check your inbox and spam folder.
Customer: Got it! Just came through. Let me reset it real quick.
Agent: Take your time!
Customer: All done, I'm logged in now. That was so easy, thank you!
Agent: You're welcome! Glad we could get you back into your account quickly. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Customer: Nope, that's everything. Thanks for the fast help!
Agent: My pleasure, Alex. Have a great day!
transcripts.customer_issue: Locked out of online account due to typo in email address preventing password reset

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Nexus Support, this is David.
Customer: I've been having issues with my service for over a month now and I'm fed up. I want to speak to a supervisor.
Agent: I understand you're frustrated. Can I get your account information and see if I can help resolve this?
Customer: No, I don't want to explain this again. I've called four times already. I want to speak to a manager right now.
Agent: I'm sure I can handle this for you. What seems to be the issue?
Customer: I just told you, I want to speak to a supervisor. Please transfer me to your manager.
Agent: Sir, if you explain the issue to me, I'm confident I can resolve it. Transferring to a supervisor will just mean a longer wait time.
Customer: I don't care about wait time. This is ridiculous. Every time I call I get the runaround. I'm asking to speak to your manager and you're arguing with me.
Agent: I'm not arguing, I'm trying to help. The supervisors handle the same issues we do. Let me just pull up your account.
Customer: This is a waste of time. I want to file a complaint about my service AND about this call. You're supposed to transfer me when I ask for a supervisor.
Agent: Fine. Can I at least get your account number so I can pass it to the supervisor?
Customer: It's 3310-7756. And make sure you tell them I've been trying to get this escalated for weeks.
Agent: Okay, I'm going to put you on a brief hold while I transfer you.
Customer: How long is the hold going to be?
Agent: It shouldn't be more than a few minutes.
Customer: It better not be. I've already wasted enough time on this.
Agent: Okay, please hold.
Customer: Fine.
transcripts.customer_issue: Ongoing unresolved service issues for over a month, customer demanding supervisor escalation

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Thank you for calling Nexus Sales. This call may be recorded for quality and training purposes. My name is Sarah, how can I help you today?
Customer: Hi Sarah. I've been thinking about upgrading my internet plan. I currently have the basic 100 Mbps and I think I need something faster.
Agent: I'd be happy to help you find the right plan! Can I start with your account number?
Customer: Sure, it's 4420-8815.
Agent: Thank you. And can you verify your name and email for me?
Customer: Patricia Gomez, patricia.gomez@yahoo.com.
Agent: Perfect, I have your account here. You're right, you're currently on our Basic 100 plan at $49.99 per month. Can you tell me a bit about what you're using the internet for? That way I can recommend the best option.
Customer: Well, my son just started gaming online and my husband and I both work from home a few days a week. We do a lot of video calls. Lately everything has been really slow when we're all online at the same time.
Agent: That makes a lot of sense. With multiple people on video calls plus gaming, you'd definitely benefit from more bandwidth. I'd recommend our Premium 500 plan. It's $79.99 per month and gives you 500 Mbps, which is more than enough for your household.
Customer: That's $30 more per month though. Is it worth it?
Agent: Absolutely. With your current usage patterns, the 500 Mbps plan would eliminate the buffering and slowdowns you're experiencing. Plus, it includes our priority support line, so if you ever have issues, you go straight to the front of the queue. We're also running a promotion right now where you get the first two months at the basic plan price, so $49.99 for the first two months.
Customer: Oh that's nice. And there's no contract lock-in?
Agent: It's a 12-month agreement, but you can cancel anytime after the first 90 days with no early termination fee.
Customer: Okay, let's do it. Upgrade me to the 500 plan.
Agent: Excellent choice! I've upgraded your account to the Premium 500 plan effective today. Your first bill will still show the promotional rate of $49.99, and the regular rate of $79.99 kicks in starting month three. Your new speed should be active within the next two hours.
Customer: Great, thank you Sarah!
Agent: You're welcome, Patricia! I'm excited for you to experience the faster speeds. Is there anything else I can help with?
Customer: No, that's everything.
Agent: Wonderful. Thank you for choosing Nexus, and enjoy the upgrade! Have a great day.
Customer: Thanks, bye!
transcripts.customer_issue: Customer looking to upgrade internet plan due to slow speeds with multiple users

transcripts.transcript_text:
Agent: Thank you for calling Nexus Customer Support. This call may be recorded for quality and training purposes. My name is Sarah, how can I assist you today?
Customer: Hi Sarah. Um, this is a difficult call to make. My mother passed away last week and I need to handle her Nexus account.
Agent: I'm so sorry for your loss. Please take your time, and I'll do everything I can to make this as easy as possible for you.
Customer: Thank you. Her name was Dorothy Ellison and I need to either close her account or transfer it to my name.
Agent: Of course. First, let me express my sincere condolences. Losing a parent is incredibly difficult, and I want to make sure we handle this with the care it deserves. There's no rush at all on this call.
Customer: I appreciate that. I have her account number, it's 9910-5523.
Agent: Thank you. And may I ask your name?
Customer: I'm Catherine Ellison, her daughter.
Agent: Thank you, Catherine. I've pulled up your mother's account. Before we discuss the options, I want to let you know that there will be no charges or fees associated with anything we do today. Whatever you decide, we'll waive any applicable fees given the circumstances.
Customer: Oh, that's very kind. Thank you.
Agent: Of course. So you have two options. The first is to close the account entirely. If there's a remaining balance, we'll waive it. If there's a credit, we can issue a refund check to you as the next of kin. The second option is to transfer the service to your name if you're at the same address or would like to keep the service.
Customer: I think I'd like to transfer it to my name. I'm staying in her house now to sort through everything, and I need the internet service.
Agent: That's completely understandable. I can set up the transfer for you. I'll just need a few pieces of information. Do you have a copy of the death certificate? We'll need it for our records, but you can email or mail it at your convenience. There's no rush.
Customer: Yes, I have a copy. I can email it.
Agent: Perfect. I'll give you the email address at the end of the call. For now, let me start the transfer. Can I get your date of birth and a phone number for the new account?
Customer: My date of birth is June 22, 1985, and my phone is 541-555-0392.
Agent: Thank you. I've initiated the transfer. The account will now be in your name, Catherine Ellison, effective today. Your mother's billing cycle had just started, so I've waived this month's charges entirely. Your first bill will start next month.
Customer: That's so thoughtful. Thank you, Sarah. Everyone I've dealt with during this process has been so cold and transactional, but you've been genuinely kind.
Agent: I'm glad I could help, even in a small way. Dealing with these practical matters while grieving is overwhelming, and I just want to make sure this one thing is handled smoothly for you. The email address for the death certificate is accounts@nexus-support.com. Take your time sending it, there's no deadline.
Customer: Thank you. I really do appreciate how patient and caring you've been.
Agent: It's the least I can do, Catherine. If you need anything else with the account, or if you have any questions in the future, please don't hesitate to call. We're here for you. Take care of yourself.
Customer: Thank you, Sarah. Goodbye.
Agent: Goodbye, Catherine. I'm wishing you and your family all the best.
transcripts.customer_issue: Account transfer due to death of account holder (mother), daughter requesting service transfer to her name
